questions.infoText: [Description of Designated Contact Person] You must designate a designated contact person to be in charge of the company's business contact. The designated contact person will be in charge of major business contact with our company, and their duties include contacting you regarding company and business-related inquiries, checking progress, and registered documents. The designated contact person can view your company's information and documents, and can also view your company's mail. Designating one contact person is free of charge, and for two or more, an annual fee of USD 250 will be charged per person. The delegated designated contact person will be designated by your company and registered separately with our company, thereby protecting your company's information and reducing confusion in business. (The delegated designated contact person must provide a scanned copy of the front and back of their ID.) **Note: If the designated contact person changes, you must immediately contact us to update this information, fill out this form individually, and submit the required documents.

questions.question: Are you a politically prominent figure who fits the description above, or do you have an immediate family member or close acquaintance who holds a high-ranking public office, is a politician, government official, military or international organization official, or is a politically prominent figure?
questions.infoText: Politically Exposed Person (Source: FATF Guidance: Politically Exposed Persons (Rec 12 and 22)) 1. A foreign politically exposed person means a person who currently or has had political or social influence in a foreign country. For example, a senior official in the executive, judicial, defense, or other government agencies of a foreign government, a senior official in a major foreign political party, or a manager in a foreign state-owned enterprise. 2. A domestic politically exposed person means a person who currently or has had political or social influence in a domestic country. (For example, a senior official in the executive, judicial, defense, or other government agencies of a domestic government, a senior official in a major domestic political party, or a manager in a foreign state-owned enterprise.) 3. A politically exposed person of an international organization means a person who has influence in an international organization, for example, a director, officer, member of the board of directors, senior management, or a person with equivalent authority. 4. A politically exposed person in a family relationship means a parent, sibling, spouse, child, or relative by blood or marriage. 5. A close politically important person refers to a person who has a close social or business relationship with a politically important person.
